IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MATERIALS RESEARCH SOCIETY (MRS) IS AN ORGANIZATION OF MATERIALS RESEARCHERS WORLDWIDE THAT PROMOTES COMMUNICATION FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF INTERDISCIPLINARY MATERIALS RESEARCH AND TECHNOLOGY TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO FOSTER INTERACTION AMONG SCIENTISTS INVOLVED IN THE PREPARATION, CHARACTERIZATION, DESIGN, AND UTILIZATION OF VARIOUS MATERIALS.
IRS990.Desc: SYMPOSIA AND MEETINGS SPONSOR INTERDISCIPLINARY MEETINGS OF INTEREST TO THE MATERIALS SCIENCE COMMUNITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUBSCRIPTIONS AND PUBLICATIONSTO FURTHER INTERDISCIPLINARY COMMUNICATION AND EDUCATION IN MATERIALS SCIENCE

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: MEMBERSHIPTO FOSTER INTERACTION BETWEEN THOSE WORKING IN FIELDS OF MATERIALS SCIENCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A QUASI-ENDOWMENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF ESTABLISHING A GRADUATE STUDENT, MATERIALS CHARACTERIZATION, MATERIALS THEORY AND MID CAREER RESEARCHER AWARDS. A PORTION OF THE FUNDS ALSO RELATE TO THE DAVID TURNBULL LECTURESHIP FUND WHICH WAS ESTABLISHED TO RECOGNIZE THE CAREER OF A SCIENTIST WHO MADE OUTSTANDING CONTRIBUTIONS IN THE AREA OF MATERIALS RESEARCH.

ForeignIndividualsGrantsGrp.RegionTxt: EUROPE (INCLUDING ICELAND & GREENLAND) - ALBANIA, ANDORRA, AUSTRIA, BELGIU

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THESE REPRESENT EITHER AWARD GRANTS FOR NOTABLE SERVICES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS IN THE MATERIALS SCIENCE FIELD OR ARE HONORARIA FOR LECTURES AND ARE MADE WITHOUT RESTRICTION

GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BASED ON PROJECT EVALUATION/SELECTION OR PAST NOTABLE SERVICES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS TO THE MATERIALS RESEARCH FIELD. GRANT RECIPIENTS ARE SELECTED BY SPECIFIED COMMITTEES AND OFTEN ARE SUBJECT TO BOARD APPROVAL.
EMPLOYER CONTRIBUTION TO 457(F) NON-QUALIFIED DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT FOR THE YEAR ENDED 12/31/15 -TODD M OSMAN: $10,266

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOCIETY'S MEMBERS ELECT THE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY AND APPROVE SIGNIFICANT DECISIONS OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SOCIETY CONSISTS OF MORE THAN 16,000 MEMBERS FROM THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA AND MORE THAN 90 OTHER COUNTRIES. MEMBERS AND THE HEADQUARTERS STAFF WORK TOGETHER ENCOURAGING INTERDISCIPLINARY COMMUNICATION AND TECHNICAL INFORMATION EXCHANGE ACROSS THE VARIOUS FIELDS OF SCIENCE AFFECTING MATERIALS OF TECHNOLOGICAL IMPORTANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE SOCIETY ARE ENTITLED TO VOTE: (A) FOR DIRECTORS; (B) FOR THE VICE PRESIDENT AND SECRETARY; (C) ON AMENDMENTS TO THE CONSTITUTION; (D) ON MEMBER-INITIATED REFERENDUMS RELATED TO BYLAWS ADOPTED OR CHANGED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS; AND (E) ON PROPOSALS SUBMITTED BY MEMBERS TO REMOVE OFFICERS OR DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS VOTE TO ELECT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND ON SELECTED MATTERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD HAS APPOINTED THE AUDIT COMMITTEE TO REVIEW THE 990 BEFORE SUBMISSION. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REPORTS BACK TO THE BOARD ON THE 990. THE 990 IS MADE AVAILABLE TO THE ENTIRE BOARD BEFORE SUBMISSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH YEAR, DURING THE FALL BOARD MEETING EACH BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ACKNOWLEDGMENT. THE EMPLOYEE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IS INCLUDED IN THE EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK, WHICH REQUIRES A SIGNATURE OF ACKNOWLEDGMENT ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANNUAL COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS ARE BASED ON INDIVIDUAL PERFORMANCE, MARKET INFLUENCES AND THE FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE OF THE SOCIETY. MARKET INFLUENCES INCLUDE, CPI INFORMATION, COMPARABILITY DATA FROM CONSULTANTS AND/OR BENCHMARK SURVEYS, INFORMATION FROM INDUSTRY WHERE, APPLICABLE, AND COMPA RATIO METHOD ESTABLISHED IN PRIOR YEARS BY COMPENSATION CONSULTANTS. ALL COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENTS FOR STAFF ARE APPROVED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WITH COMPARABILITY DATA AND COMPENSATION FOR TOP MANAGEMENT STAFF BEING REVIEWED BY THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION ADJUSTMENT IS SET BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE ON THE MRS WEBSITE. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. FINANCIAL STATEMENT SUMMARY IS ON WEBSITE.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
